sites.name: Tivoli Gardens
sites.description: Tivoli Gardens, one of the oldest amusement parks in the world, opened in 1843. It is famous for its vintage roller coasters, beautiful flower gardens, and evening illuminations. The park hosts concerts and events throughout the year and is a beloved cultural icon in Copenhagen.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open from April to September and during Christmas. It gets crowded during summer and holiday seasons.
sites.booking_tips: Tickets can be purchased online to avoid long queues, especially during peak seasons.

sites.name: Nyhavn
sites.description: Nyhavn is a 17th-century waterfront, canal, and entertainment district. Known for its brightly colored 17th and early 18th-century townhouses, it was once a bustling commercial port but is now lined with restaurants and bars.
sites.seasonal_notes: Popular all year, especially during summer and Christmas for its markets.
sites.booking_tips: No booking necessary to visit the area; reservations recommended for dining.

sites.name: The Little Mermaid
sites.description: The Little Mermaid statue is an iconic symbol of Copenhagen, inspired by Hans Christian Andersen's fairy tale. The bronze statue, created by Edvard Eriksen, has been a major tourist attraction since 1913.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round, but early mornings are less crowded.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Consider visiting early to avoid crowds.

sites.name: Rosenborg Castle
sites.description: Rosenborg Castle is a renaissance castle built as a country summerhouse in 1606 and is one of the most well-preserved buildings of its era. It houses the Danish crown jewels and royal regalia.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open all year, though hours may vary during winter. It's less crowded during weekdays.
sites.booking_tips: Tickets can be bought online, especially during peak tourist seasons to ensure entry.

sites.name: Amalienborg Palace
sites.description: Amalienborg is the home of the Danish royal family and consists of four identical classical palace fa√ßades around an octagonal courtyard. It is famous for its Royal Guard ceremony.
sites.seasonal_notes: The changing of the guard happens daily and is a major attraction.
sites.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online to save time. Arrive early for a good view of the guard ceremony.

sites.name: The National Museum of Denmark
sites.description: The National Museum offers a comprehensive overview of Danish history and culture, featuring exhibits from the Stone Age to the modern era, including Viking artifacts.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round; typically less crowded on weekdays.
sites.booking_tips: Online booking is recommended to avoid queues, especially during weekends.

sites.name: Christiansborg Palace
sites.description: Christiansborg Palace is the seat of the Danish Parliament, the Prime Minister's Office, and the Supreme Court. Visitors can explore the royal reception rooms, the ruins beneath the palace, and the royal stables.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round with varied hours during winter.
sites.booking_tips: Advance booking is recommended to explore the royal reception rooms.

sites.name: The Round Tower
sites.description: Built in the 17th century, the Round Tower is Europe's oldest functioning observatory. Its unique spiral ramp and panoramic views of Copenhagen make it a must-visit.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round; views are best on clear days.
sites.booking_tips: Tickets can be purchased on-site; visiting on weekdays can avoid weekend crowds.

sites.name: Frederik's Church (The Marble Church)
sites.description: Known for its impressive rococo architecture, Frederik's Church has the largest church dome in Scandinavia with a span of 31 meters. It is a key religious and architectural landmark.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round; less crowded in the mornings.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required; guided tours may be available.

sites.name: The Glyptotek
sites.description: Ny Carlsberg Glyptotek is an art museum that houses a vast collection of ancient and modern art, including works by Rodin and a significant collection of Roman and Greek sculptures.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round; less crowded on weekdays.
sites.booking_tips: Tickets can be purchased online; consider visiting on a weekday for a quieter experience.

sites.name: Copenhagen Opera House
sites.description: The Copenhagen Opera House is one of the most modern opera houses in the world, known for its stunning architecture and world-class productions. Situated on the island of Holmen, it offers breathtaking views of the city.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round with a varied program; tickets for performances can sell out quickly.
sites.booking_tips: Book tickets well in advance for popular performances.

sites.name: Freetown Christiania
sites.description: Christiania is a self-proclaimed autonomous neighborhood in Copenhagen, known for its unique community, art, and alternative lifestyle. It's a vibrant area with cafes, music venues, and galleries.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round, with more activities during warmer months.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required; guided tours are available for a deeper understanding.

sites.name: Stroget
sites.description: Stroget is one of Europe's longest pedestrian streets, lined with shops ranging from budget-friendly chains to high-end boutiques. It's a central hub for shopping and dining in Copenhagen.
sites.seasonal_notes: Bustling year-round; particularly busy during sales and holiday seasons.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required; visit in the morning for fewer crowds.

sites.name: Kastellet
sites.description: Kastellet is one of the best-preserved star fortresses in Northern Europe. It is a peaceful green oasis with historical buildings and a windmill, perfect for a scenic walk.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round; ideal for a stroll during spring and summer.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required; guided tours may be available.

sites.name: Carlsberg Brewery
sites.description: The Carlsberg Brewery, founded in 1847, is a historic brewery that offers tours covering the history of Carlsberg beer, brewing processes, and samples.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round; less crowded during weekdays.
sites.booking_tips: Book tickets online for tours, especially during weekends.

sites.name: The Botanical Garden
sites.description: Copenhagen's Botanical Garden is a haven for plant enthusiasts, featuring over 13,000 species. The garden includes historical glasshouses and a beautiful lake.
sites.seasonal_notes: Best visited in spring and summer when flowers are in full bloom.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required; guided tours may be available.

sites.name: Louisiana Museum of Modern Art
sites.description: Located just north of Copenhagen, the Louisiana Museum of Modern Art is renowned for its contemporary art collection, sculptures, and scenic location overlooking the √òresund Strait.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round; busiest during special exhibitions.
sites.booking_tips: Tickets can be purchased online. Plan a full day trip to explore both the art and the surrounding landscape.

sites.name: Church of Our Saviour
sites.description: Famous for its spiral tower with external staircase, the Church of Our Saviour offers panoramic views of Copenhagen. The baroque church is an architectural masterpiece completed in 1695.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round; tower access may be closed during bad weather.
sites.booking_tips: Tickets for the tower can be purchased on-site; arrive early to avoid queues.

sites.name: The Royal Danish Playhouse
sites.description: A modern architectural masterpiece, the Royal Danish Playhouse hosts a range of theatrical performances and offers stunning views of the harbor.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round with a varied program; winter performances are popular.
sites.booking_tips: Booking in advance is recommended for popular shows.

sites.name: The David Collection
sites.description: The David Collection is a unique museum that houses one of the largest collections of Islamic art in Scandinavia, alongside European 18th-century art and Danish Early Modern art.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round; quieter during weekdays.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required; guided tours may be available.

neighborhoods.name: Indre By (Inner City)
neighborhoods.character: The historic heart of Copenhagen, vibrant and bustling with shops, cafes, and cultural sites.

location.description: Located at the center of Copenhagen, it is the oldest part of the city.

history.overview: Dating back to the 12th century, it has been the core of Copenhagen's development.
history.significance: Home to many of the city‚Äôs historic and cultural landmarks.

practical_info.safety: Generally safe, though crowded areas can attract pickpockets.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Spring and summer for pleasant weather and outdoor events.
practical_info.walkability: Highly walkable with pedestrian streets and central parks.

attractions.name: Nyhavn
attractions.description: A 17th-century waterfront, canal and entertainment district.

Germany's second-largest city, known for its beautiful harbor and vibrant nightlife.
A charming city known for its Dutch-style canals and leafy boulevards.
A multicultural city with a mix of modern and historic architecture, connected by the √òresund Bridge.
Known for its prestigious university and well-preserved medieval city center.
Sweden's stunning capital city, spread across 14 islands.
Norway's capital, known for its green spaces and museums.
Germany's capital, rich in history and contemporary arts.
Known for its artistic heritage, elaborate canal system and narrow houses.
The heart of the European Union, known for its chocolates and waffles.
The romantic capital of France, known for its art, fashion, and culture.
Finland's capital, known for its design and seaside location.
The northernmost capital of a sovereign state, known for its vibrant culture and stunning landscapes.
Known for its baroque architecture and vibrant arts scene.
Known for its wooden buildings, art nouveau architecture, and medieval Old Town.
Famed for its medieval old town, a UNESCO World Heritage site.
Poland's capital, known for its modern skyline and historic Old Town.
The city of a hundred spires, known for its Old Town Square and Gothic churches.
Austria's capital, known for its artistic and intellectual legacy.
Known for its picturesque lakeside setting and vibrant cultural scene.
Italy's fashion capital, known for its high-end dining and shopping.
The Eternal City, known for its nearly 3,000 years of globally influential art and architecture.
Known for its art and architecture, vibrant culture, and Mediterranean beaches.
Spain's central capital, known for its rich repositories of European art.
Ireland's vibrant capital, known for its friendly locals and rich history.
The UK's capital, known for its rich history, culture, and iconic landmarks.
Scotland's hilly capital, known for its historic and architectural attractions.

activities.name: Visit Tivoli Gardens
activities.description: Tivoli Gardens is one of the oldest amusement parks in the world, offering a mix of thrilling rides, beautiful gardens, and live performances.
activities.seasonal_notes: Springtime sees the gardens in full bloom, making it a perfect time to enjoy the park's floral beauty.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online to avoid queues and check the schedule for special spring events.

activities.name: Cherry Blossom at Bispebjerg Cemetery
activities.description: Experience the breathtaking sight of cherry blossoms in full bloom at Bispebjerg Cemetery, a local favorite for springtime strolls.
activities.seasonal_notes: The cherry blossoms typically bloom in April, creating a picturesque and serene environment.
activities.booking_tips: Visit early in the morning to avoid crowds and capture the best photos.

activities.name: Copenhagen Spring Jazz Festival
activities.description: This annual festival showcases a variety of jazz performances across multiple venues in the city.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring marks the start of the festival season in Copenhagen, with jazz music filling the air.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets in advance and explore different venues for a diverse experience.

activities.name: Explore Nyhavn
activities.description: Nyhavn is a vibrant waterfront area known for its colorful buildings, historic ships, and lively atmosphere.
activities.seasonal_notes: The mild spring weather makes it an ideal time to explore the outdoor cafes and restaurants.
activities.booking_tips: Arrive early to secure a spot at a popular caf√© and enjoy the view.

activities.name: Frederiksberg Garden Picnic
activities.description: Enjoy a relaxing picnic in Frederiksberg Garden, a large park with beautiful landscapes and a serene lake.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring is perfect for outdoor picnics as the weather warms up and flowers bloom.
activities.booking_tips: Prepare your picnic supplies in advance and bring a blanket for comfort.

activities.name: Copenhagen Sakura Festival
activities.description: Held annually in Langelinie Park, this festival celebrates Japanese culture with food stalls, performances, and traditional ceremonies.
activities.seasonal_notes: The festival coincides with the cherry blossom season, adding to the festive atmosphere.
activities.booking_tips: Check the schedule for specific events and arrive early to participate in workshops.

activities.name: Botanical Garden Visit
activities.description: Explore the extensive collection of plants at the Botanical Garden, featuring greenhouses and themed gardens.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring is an ideal time to see the garden's wide variety of plants begin to bloom.
activities.booking_tips: Guided tours are available; check the schedule to join one.

activities.name: Copenhagen Marathon
activities.description: Join or watch the Copenhagen Marathon, a major event attracting runners from around the world.
activities.seasonal_notes: The event takes place in May, benefiting from the cool spring weather.
activities.booking_tips: Register early if participating, and plan your viewing spot along the route.

activities.name: Visit the National Museum of Denmark
activities.description: Discover Danish history and culture through extensive exhibits, including Viking artifacts and royal collections.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring showers make indoor museum visits a pleasant option.
activities.booking_tips: Weekdays are less crowded. Check for any special spring exhibitions.

activities.name: Copenhagen Zoo
activities.description: Home to over 3,000 animals, the Copenhagen Zoo offers a fun and educational experience for visitors of all ages.
activities.seasonal_notes: The longer summer days provide ample time to explore the entire zoo.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online for discounts and check feeding schedules in advance.

activities.name: Roskilde Festival
activities.description: One of Europe's largest music festivals, Roskilde features a diverse lineup of artists and a vibrant atmosphere.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held in late June to early July, the festival is a highlight of the Danish summer.
activities.booking_tips: Tickets sell out quickly, so book early and consider camping on-site for the full experience.

activities.name: Beach Day at Amager Strandpark
activities.description: Amager Strandpark is Copenhagen's largest beach, offering sandy shores, swimming areas, and water sports.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer temperatures make it perfect for a refreshing dip in the sea.
activities.booking_tips: Bring a picnic and sunscreen, and check for windsurfing lessons if interested.

activities.name: Canal Tour
activities.description: Explore Copenhagen from the water with a guided canal tour, offering views of iconic landmarks like the Little Mermaid and Christiansborg Palace.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer's clear skies provide the best visibility for sightseeing.
activities.booking_tips: Book tickets online to secure a spot and bring a hat for sun protection.

activities.name: Copenhagen Jazz Festival
activities.description: A city-wide festival featuring hundreds of jazz concerts in various venues, both indoor and outdoor.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held every July, the festival captures the lively summer spirit of the city.
activities.booking_tips: Check the program for free concerts and consider purchasing a festival pass for multiple events.

activities.name: Tivoli Gardens Summer Nights
activities.description: Experience Tivoli Gardens after dark with live music, fireworks, and illuminated rides.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer evenings are magical at Tivoli, with extended opening hours.
activities.booking_tips: Buy a multi-ride ticket for savings if you plan to enjoy many attractions.

activities.name: Street Food at Reffen
activities.description: Reffen is a popular street food market located on the industrial Refshale√∏en island, offering diverse international cuisines.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer evenings are perfect for enjoying food and drinks outdoors with a view of the harbor.
activities.booking_tips: Go with a group to try a variety of dishes and arrive early for a good seat.

activities.name: Visit the Louisiana Museum of Modern Art
activities.description: Located north of Copenhagen, this museum offers stunning modern art exhibits and beautiful views over the √òresund Strait.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer allows visitors to enjoy the museum's sculpture garden and outdoor installations.
activities.booking_tips: Consider a combined train and museum ticket for a convenient trip from Copenhagen.

activities.name: Cycling Tour of Copenhagen
activities.description: Join a guided cycling tour to explore Copenhagen's bike-friendly streets, historic sites, and green spaces.
activities.seasonal_notes: The warm, sunny summer weather makes cycling the ideal way to see the city.
activities.booking_tips: Wear comfortable clothing and book in advance to ensure a spot on a popular tour.

activities.name: Visit the Glyptoteket
activities.description: Explore a collection of ancient and modern art at the Ny Carlsberg Glyptotek, including works by Rodin and Degas.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn is great for museum visits as the weather cools, offering a cozy retreat.
activities.booking_tips: Visit on a Tuesday for free entry and consider using the audio guide for detailed insights.

activities.name: Copenhagen Cooking & Food Festival
activities.description: A celebration of Nordic cuisine, featuring cooking workshops, gourmet tastings, and food markets.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held in late August to early September, it's ideal for experiencing seasonal Danish flavors.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase event tickets early, as popular workshops sell out quickly.

activities.name: Autumn Leaves at Frederiksberg Palace Gardens
activities.description: Stroll through the picturesque gardens of Frederiksberg Palace, known for its stunning autumn foliage.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn transforms the gardens into a vibrant tapestry of colors, perfect for photography.
activities.booking_tips: Visit on weekdays to enjoy a quieter experience and capture the best light in the morning.

activities.name: Copenhagen Art Week
activities.description: A city-wide celebration of contemporary art, featuring exhibitions, performances, and talks across various venues.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held in September, it's a cultural highlight as the city embraces the arts in the fall.
activities.booking_tips: Check the program for free events and guided tours, and plan your itinerary in advance.

activities.name: Carlsberg Brewery Tour
activities.description: Learn about the history of Carlsberg and the beer-making process on a guided tour of the brewery.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn is a great time to enjoy a cozy indoor activity like a brewery tour.
activities.booking_tips: Book your tour online to ensure availability, and don't miss the tasting session at the end.

activities.name: Halloween at Tivoli Gardens
activities.description: Experience spooky decorations, haunted houses, and special Halloween-themed rides at Tivoli Gardens.
activities.seasonal_notes: Tivoli transforms into a Halloween wonderland during October, offering festive fun for all ages.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase your tickets in advance and consider a multi-ride pass for savings.

activities.name: Visit Rosenborg Castle
activities.description: Discover Danish royal history at Rosenborg Castle, home to the crown jewels and beautiful royal gardens.
activities.seasonal_notes: The castle provides a warm refuge on crisp autumn days, with fewer crowds than in summer.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase a combined ticket with Amalienborg Palace for a complete royal experience.

activities.name: Kayaking in the Canals
activities.description: Explore Copenhagen from the water on a guided kayaking tour through its historic canals.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn offers a peaceful time to kayak, with the canals less crowded than in summer.
activities.booking_tips: Wear layers to stay warm and book in advance to ensure a spot on the tour.

activities.name: Visit the Design Museum Denmark
activities.description: Discover Danish design history and innovation at this museum, featuring furniture, fashion, and industrial design.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn is perfect for exploring indoor cultural attractions as the city cools down.
activities.booking_tips: Check for temporary exhibitions and visit on a weekday for a quieter experience.

activities.name: Copenhagen Christmas Markets
activities.description: Explore the festive Christmas markets at Tivoli Gardens, Nyhavn, and H√∏jbro Plads, offering holiday treats, crafts, and gifts.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter is the perfect time to enjoy the cozy atmosphere and holiday spirit of Copenhagen's Christmas markets.
activities.booking_tips: Visit on weekday evenings to avoid weekend crowds and bring cash for small purchases.

activities.name: Ice Skating at Frederiksberg Runddel
activities.description: Enjoy ice skating at this charming outdoor rink located near Frederiksberg Gardens, a winter favorite for locals.
activities.seasonal_notes: The rink is open during the winter months, providing a fun and active way to embrace the cold weather.
activities.booking_tips: Rent skates on-site and dress warmly in layers to stay comfortable.

activities.name: Ny Carlsberg Glyptotek Winter Exhibitions
activities.description: Visit the Glyptotek for its winter exhibitions, featuring a rich collection of sculptures and paintings in a beautiful historic setting.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter is ideal for exploring Copenhagen's museums, offering warmth and cultural enrichment.
activities.booking_tips: Check for special winter exhibitions and free admission days.

activities.name: New Year's Eve Fireworks at Tivoli
activities.description: Celebrate New Year's Eve with a spectacular fireworks display at Tivoli Gardens, a beloved Copenhagen tradition.
activities.seasonal_notes: Tivoli's New Year's celebrations are a highlight of the winter season, drawing locals and tourists alike.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets in advance, as this event sells out quickly, and arrive early for the best view.

activities.name: Bakken Winter Opening
activities.description: Experience the winter season at Bakken, the world's oldest amusement park, with special winter-themed attractions and entertainment.
activities.seasonal_notes: Bakken offers a unique winter experience with festive decorations and seasonal activities.
activities.booking_tips: Check the opening dates and consider a rides pass for access to all attractions.

activities.name: Warm Up at a Copenhagen Caf√©
activities.description: Enjoy a cozy break at one of Copenhagen's charming caf√©s, such as The Living Room or Caf√© Norden, known for their hygge atmosphere.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter is the perfect time to embrace hygge culture, with warm drinks and cozy settings.
activities.booking_tips: Visit during off-peak hours to secure a comfortable spot by the fire.

activities.name: Visit Frederiksborg Castle
activities.description: Explore the grandeur of Frederiksborg Castle, featuring beautiful Baroque architecture and extensive art collections.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter provides a quieter time to visit the castle, with fewer tourists and a serene landscape.
activities.booking_tips: Take a train from Copenhagen and consider a guided tour for in-depth insights.

activities.name: Copenhagen Light Festival
activities.description: Marvel at the art installations and light displays that illuminate the city during the Copenhagen Light Festival.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held in February, the festival brightens the long winter nights with stunning visual displays.
activities.booking_tips: Dress warmly and plan your route to see the most iconic installations.

activities.name: Winter Bathing at Helgoland
activities.description: Join the local tradition of winter bathing at Helgoland, a bathing club at Amager Strand, for a refreshing and invigorating experience.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter bathing is a popular Danish activity, believed to boost circulation and mood.
activities.booking_tips: Bring a warm towel and change of clothes, and check club hours for visitor access.

ranges.notes: Public holiday, most businesses closed, recovery from New Year's Eve celebrations, winter atmosphere at Nyhavn
Winter sales begin, cold weather, few tourists, good time for museum visits like National Museum and Glyptotek
Winter weather continues, few tourists, excellent time for museums and indoor attractions
Special menus at harbor-side restaurants, romantic experiences at historic venues
Jazz performances across venues in Copenhagen, featuring local and international artists
Early spring with unpredictable weather, gradual warming, indoor-outdoor activities at covered venues like Torvehallerne
One of Europe's largest documentary film festivals with screenings throughout the city
Easter markets at Kongens Nytorv, extended shopping hours, special brunches at restaurants across the city
Spring weather improves, blooming gardens at Rosenborg Castle, outdoor caf√© culture begins at Nyhavn
Public holiday with demonstrations and events, particularly in F√¶lledparken
Events, exhibitions and guided tours of Copenhagen's famous architecture
Perfect spring conditions, flowering gardens at Tivoli, excellent time for harbor tours and outdoor dining
Major running event through the streets of Copenhagen passing many landmarks
Early summer weather, excellent for outdoor activities, harbor-side dining, and exploration of the historic center
Traditional bonfires along the harbor and beaches, particularly at Islands Brygge
Pre-festival atmosphere as one of Europe's largest music festivals begins nearby
One of Europe's largest jazz festivals with hundreds of concerts across the city
Peak summer weather, harbor swimming at Islands Brygge, outdoor dining throughout Nyhavn and Christianshavn
Peak summer weather, harbor swimming at Amager Beach Park, cycling throughout the city
Week-long celebration culminating in parade through the city center, festivities at City Hall Square
Culinary events throughout the city celebrating Nordic cuisine and food innovation
History and cultural festival with events at museums and historic sites throughout Copenhagen
Pleasant early autumn weather, fewer tourists than summer, beautiful light for photography in the historic districts
Film screenings and events celebrating LGBTQ+ cinema at venues throughout the city
Autumn colors in city parks like Frederiksberg Gardens, cultural season begins at Royal Danish Theatre
Quieter tourism period, increasingly cooler weather, transition to indoor activities and museums
Holiday markets open at Tivoli Gardens, Nyhavn, and Kongens Nytorv with festive decorations and traditional foods
Holiday markets at Tivoli Gardens, Nyhavn, and H√∏jbro Plads, festive decorations throughout the historic center, hygge atmosphere in cafes
Most businesses close by afternoon, traditional Danish Christmas celebrations, evening church services at Church of Our Saviour and Copenhagen Cathedral
Public holidays, most businesses closed, quiet atmosphere with limited dining options, beautiful winter ambiance in historic center
Post-Christmas period, winter markets continue, limited business hours, good time to explore museums
Citywide celebrations, fireworks displays at Tivoli Gardens and over the harbor, special events at Royal Theatre and other venues

spring: Cherry Blossom Viewing in King's Garden
summer: Day Trips to Dyrehaven Deer Park
winter: New Year's Celebrations at City Hall Square

scoreDescription.1: Poor: Unfavorable conditions, extreme weather, overcrowded or very limited activities
scoreDescription.2: Below Average: Less ideal conditions, possibly unpleasant weather or very low/high tourism (business closures)
scoreDescription.3: Average: Standard conditions, typical weather, moderate to high tourism
scoreDescription.4: Good: Very favorable conditions, pleasant weather, manageable crowds
scoreDescription.5: Excellent: Perfect conditions, special events, ideal weather, moderate crowds
